bug.author: hadusam
bug.summary: DLK tests for segmentation fail on Arm with hard_quantize=False
bug.description:
On <denchmark-link:https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/pull/511>#511</denchmark-link> , I tried to add DLK tests for the segmentation task on Arm, but the tests failed when . Is it correct behavior or not? In Classification and Object Detection, hard_quantize=False is tested and passed, so I think this is a bug.
Buildkite logs https://buildkite.com/blueoil/dlk-test/builds/588#053d1c6d-329a-440f-ba11-60a2109bd387/67-1276

comments.comment:
I found that Out of memory occurred on Arm device when running generated library. <denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce this error</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>### Generate library file for Arm with hard_quantize=False # docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd)/tmp:/output blueoil/blueoil:latest python dlk/python/dlk/scripts/generate_project.py -i dlk/examples/segmentation/lm_segnet_v1_quantize_camvid/minimal_graph_with_shape.pb -o /output # docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd)/tmp:/output blueoil/blueoil:latest bash -c "cd /output/None.prj && cmake -DTOOLCHAIN_NAME=linux_arm -DUSE_NEON=1 . && make lib -j8" # ls -l tmp/None.prj/*.so -rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 10341428 10æœˆ 8 12:12 tmp/None.prj/lib_arm.so </denchmark-code>
Put that library and some files to Arm machine.
lib_arm.so dlk/python/dlk/scripts/pylib/nnlib.py dlk/examples/segmentation/lm_segnet_v1_quantize_camvid/network_input_output.tar.gz
And run the following commands. <denchmark-code># cd [your work dir] # ls lib_arm.so network_input_output.tar.gz # tar xvf network_input_output.tar.gz # python >>> import numpy as np >>> from nnlib import NNLib as NNLib >>> >>> nn = NNLib() >>> nn.load("./lib_arm.so") True >>> nn.init() True >>> >>> proc_input = np.load("./network_input_output/000_images_placeholder:0.npy") >>> batched_proc_input = np.expand_dims(proc_input, axis=0) >>> nn.run(batched_proc_input) Killed </denchmark-code>
I found that Out of memory occurred (/var/log/syslog) <denchmark-code>Oct 8 03:43:20 blueoil-de10nano-staging-01 kernel: [ 1239.665832] python invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x26084c0, order=0, oom_score_adj=0 Oct 8 03:43:20 blueoil-de10nano-staging-01 kernel: [ 1239.665848] python cpuset=/ mems_allowed=0 Oct 8 03:43:20 blueoil-de10nano-staging-01 kernel: [ 1239.665871] CPU: 1 PID: 2087 kn2row buffer requires ~200MB memory... We must resolve <denchmark-link:https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/issues/476>#476</denchmark-link> .
